question: Where can I find the status of national resources and services?
answer: You can find the status on the '[https://status.alliancecan.ca/ Status]' website.

question: How is the national resources status page updated?
answer: The national resources status page is updated manually, not automatically.

question: When do unplanned events appear on the national resources status page?
answer: Unplanned events will appear on the national resources status page when a staff member has taken note.

question: Where should I look for the statuses of legacy systems?
answer: You should consult the appropriate consortium site for statuses of legacy systems.

question: What is the website to check the status for SciNet?
answer: The status for SciNet can be found at [https://docs.scinet.utoronto.ca].

question: Where can I find the system status for SHARCNET?
answer: The system status for SHARCNET is available at [https://www.sharcnet.ca/my/systems].

question: How do I check the hardware status for the Centre for Advanced Computing?
answer: You can check the hardware status for the Centre for Advanced Computing at [http://cac.queensu.ca/wiki/index.php/Hardware:Status].

question: What is the link to view the cluster status for ACENET?
answer: The cluster status for ACENET can be viewed at [https://www.ace-net.ca/wiki/Cluster_Status].
